icon-size.name: Conditional Icons Size
icon-size.hint: Size in pixel for the conditional icons shown on mouse over.

lesser.name: Automate Creature Cover
lesser.hint: Should the module automatically check for creature covers on the board.

standard.name: Automate Standard Cover
standard.hint: Should the module automatically check for standard covers on the board. This setting can also be set on a per-scene basis.
standard.short: Should the module automatically check for standard covers on the board.

standard-type.name: Standard Cover Calculation
standard-type.hint: How the module proceed to automatically calculate standard cover from origin to target token.

skip-cover.name: Skip Cover Validation
skip-cover.hint: When enabled, the GM won't have to manually validate when a player takes/remove conditional covers.

target.name: Allow Combat Target
target.hint: When enabled, all creatures in the combat tracker can be targeted, even those that are not currently visible on the board. This is useful when a player wants to try to attack a creature that is undetected.

validation.name: Display Validation Tokens
validation.hint: Which tokens should be displayed in the validation menu.

exposure.name: Automate Light Exposure
exposure.hint: Should the module automatically check token exposition to bright and dim light. This setting can also be set on a per-scene basis.
exposure.short: Should the module automatically check token exposition to bright and dim light.

encounter.name: Encounter Tokens Only
encounter.hint: When enabled, the module will only work with tokens belonging to the current encounter if any for most of its features. Remember to add the 'minion' and 'eidolon' traits on the creatures that should participate but not show up in the tracker. This setting also appears in the Encounter Tracker Settings.
encounter.short: The module will only work with tokens belonging to the current encounter if any.

flat-check.name: Flat Check
flat-check.hint: Should the module automatically roll a Flat-Check before an attack targeting a concealed/hidden target.

permission.name: Perception Menu Permission
permission.hint: Which minimum permission a user must have to be able to interract with the perception menu. Keep in mind that the menu is a major spoiler if given access to players.

npc-vision.name: Force NPC Vision
npc-vision.hint: When enabled, the module will force the 'Vision Enabled' option on newly created NPC tokens. This can be taxing on your client when a lot of NPCs are present in the scene. This setting can also be set on a per-scene basis.
npc-vision.short: The module will force the Vision Enabled option on newly created NPC tokens. This can be taxing on your client when a lot of NPCs are present in the scene.

dead-cover.name: Dead Give Cover
dead-cover.hint: When disabled, dead and unconscious creatures will not provide cover.

prone-cover.name: Prone Give Cover
prone-cover.hint: When disabled, prone creatures will not provide cover.

seek-template.name: Use Seek Templates
seek-template.hint: When disabled, the seek action will no longer bring up the templates dialog.

warning.npc-vision: PF2e Perception already implements everything PF2e Rules-Based NPC Vision offers, having both modules active will break stuff.

perception.title: {name} - Perception Menu
perception.nothing: No valid tokens on the board

hint.targets: Targets: the selected cover level will be conditionally added toward all the targets
hint.no-target: No Target: the system cover effect will be added to the actor with the selected level

seek.hint: Create a template to scan the area and seek for hidden/undetected creatures

flat-check.blind: Is Trying to hit something undetected

cover.take: Takes cover ({cover}) from a selection of tokens on the board
cover.remove: Removes cover from a selection of tokens on the board

player.wait: Wait for a GM to validate..
Wait for a GM to validate..

point-out.description: You indicate a creature that you can see to one or more allies, gesturing in a direction and describing the distance verbally. That creature is hidden to your allies, rather than undetected. This works only for allies who can see you and are in a position where they could potentially detect the target. If your allies can't hear or understand you, they must succeed at a Perception check against the creature's Stealth DC or they misunderstand and believe the target is in a different location.
point-out.short: If your allies can't hear or understand you, they must succeed at a Perception check against the creature's Stealth DC or they misunderstand and believe the target is in a different location
point-out.short-check: If your allies can't hear or understand you, they must succeed at a {check} or they misunderstand and believe the target is in a different location

action.only-one: Only one token/actor can be selected to use the {action} action.
action.must-one: One token/actor must be selected to use the {action} action.
action.must-target: You must target one token/actor to use the {action} action.
action.must-creature: Only a creature can use the {action} action.

template.scene: You can only place templates on the scene the token is in.
